task.title: Add a Corresponding Field with the Expression Evaluator
task.shortdesc: The Jython Evaluator script added a new field to the credit payments branch. To ensure all records have the same structure, we'll use the Expression Evaluator to add the same field to the non-credit branch.

context.p: This ensures that all records have the same format when written to the destination.
To do this, let's use data preview to verify how the Jython Evaluator adds the credit card type to records.

step.cmd: In the pipeline, click the Jython Evaluator to view the output of that processor.
Expand the first output record, scroll down, and notice the new field highlighted in green: /credit_card_type.
Add an Expression Evaluator processor to the canvas and connect the second, default stream of the Stream Selector to it.
Click the Add icon twice and configure the properties as follows:
step.info: This creates a credit_card_type field that indicates the information is not applicable.

Since we're using "n/a" as a constant for the expression, we don't need to use the dollar sign and brackets for the expression. But if we wanted to use them, we could define them as ${'credit_card_type'} and ${'N/A'}.

step.cmd: Since we don't need to change header attributes, use the Subtract icon () to delete the default header attribute expression.
Link the Expression Evaluator to the Hadoop FS destination.
